data.title: Alt+Enter Bug
data.body:
1) Run Game.exe - menu is visible
2) Press Alt+Enter - screen is empty
3) Press Alt+Enter - menu is visible
4) Press Alt+Enter - menu is visible

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B_XuF2wRVpw4X183MEJLdld3R1U

Also, how to deprecate toggling to fullscreen? I need only window mode.

data.title: Support navigation obstacle transfer between scenes
data.body:
Despite the branch name (that's what I set out to deal with), there's nothing about detour crowd here.

Changelog:
- Obstacles seek upwards in the scene hierarchy to find their DynamicNavigationMesh rather than downwards from the scene root
- Obstacles now properly clear their ownerMesh_ when scene is cleared/reset, enabling moving them from one scene to another
- Addition of Node::GetParentComponent, Node::GetParentDerivedComponent with script bindings for Angelscript and Lua

data.title: debug draw physic world will still draw constraint which is not enabled
data.body:
How to reproduce:
1. test with 13_Ragdolls.as
2. set constraint.enable = false
3. test with physics world debug draw on.
4. you will see the debug draw of constraint is still visible even constraint is not enabled

data.title: Sample 33 Urho2DSpriterAnimation is broken in master branch
data.body: In windows vs2015 64 bit, using the latest master branch, sample 33 is built and run successfully, but the animation doesn't show at all. the screen is black.

data.title: fixed the wrong behavior of spriter animation
data.body:
1, When we has only one texture in scml file, the SpriteInfo has wrong x and y values.
2, When we use SpriterPacker without the option "-trim", it will cause wrong frameWidth and frameHeight values
3, The newest version of Spriter use attribute name "object_type" instead of "type"

data.title: fixed the wrong behavior of SpriteInfo and SpritePacker
data.body:
1, When we have only one texture in a scml file, the SpriteInfo has wrong x and y values
2, When we run SpritePacker without the option "-trim", the frameWidth and frameHeight has wrong values sometimes.

data.title: correct the frameWidth and frameHeight
data.body:
If someone uses SpritePacker without option -trim, it use incorrect values of frameWidth and frameHeight sometimes, like as 

```
<SubTexture name="2" x="0" y="0" width="64" height="64" frameWidth="1768300646" frameHeight="1696621932" offsetX="0" offsetY="0" />
```

and the Sprite info would be incorrect when we has only one texture.

data.body:
node->Rotate(Quaternion(0,0,0)); // or any value
node->GetWorldDirection() then fluctuates between two values, frame-by-frame.

data.title: class HttpRequest is missing URHO3D_API in definition
data.body: thus cannot be used when URHO3D_LIB_TYPE=SHARED

data.title: sse_micro_opts
data.body: Optimize away some uses of _MM_TRANSPOSE4_PS(), to remove two shuffles, two movs and replace shufps with the lighter movehl/lh and unpacks. Also do vector loads and stores manually in BoundingBox::Transformed() to avoid VS2015 from generating dirty asm code for the function. This has a few percent improvement on the heavy BoundingBox::Transformed() function call.

data.title: UI layout may force the parent element outside its min/max size range
data.body:
If the child element sizing requirements can't be satisfied otherwise, the layouting code doesn't respect the parent's min/max sizes, unless it's set to completely fixed size.

Investigate possible fixes, for example simple overflow in case of max size being exceeded, and adding padding between children if children are smaller than minimum.

Changes of behavior may cause existing layouts relying on this to "break".

data.body:
I pulled the latest master yesterday (14 Oct 2015) and it built well, the sample applications run without problem but Urho3DPlayer crashes when you try to run some scripts, like scripts that have zone component or physics component.

data.title: sse_opt_quat
data.body: SSE optimizes functions in Quaternion.h.

data.title: no_boundingbox_bool
data.body:
This PR shows how to get rid of the `defined_` boolean in `BoundingBox` class, and instead use `min = INF` and `max = -INF` denote the case when a bounding box is degenerate. This helps reduce branching and SSE'ifying BoundingBox. Using this scheme, it might be possible to further reduce `if (box.Defined())` checks in the codebase, since given how the math falls out, such arithmetic can naturally yield a desired negative result (no hit, outside, etc.) depending on the case.

Also SSE optimizes some hot BoundingBox functions and adds dummy padding floats to `BoundingBox` structure to help SSE loads and stores, which seems safe to do here.

There is also a small (pedantic) logic fix for `BoundingBox::Define(const Vector3* vertices, unsigned count)` when `count == 0`, which should probably define a degenerate box, instead of keeping the old one around(?).

The performance improvement here is rather small, about 3% on the 10k Jacks scene, and this carries an API change that extends to the scripting languages, so it is understandable if there is a concern merging this.

If this looks interesting, I noticed that classes `Rect` and `Sphere` also use such a `defined_` scheme, which could be removed using the same techniques.

data.title: allow_enable_sse_on_emscripten
data.body: Enable setting -DURHO3D_SSE=1 on Emscripten, but leave it disabled by default.

data.title: Suspicious implicit Quaternion constructors
data.body:
The class `Quaternion` has the following two implicit constructors:

```
/// Construct from an angle (in degrees, for Urho2D).
Quaternion(float angle)
{
    FromAngleAxis(angle, Vector3::FORWARD);
}

/// Construct from a rotation matrix.
Quaternion(const Matrix3& matrix)
{
    FromRotationMatrix(matrix);
}
```

which both serve as implicit conversion operators, e.g. in assignments, like `someQuat = someFloat;` or `someQuat = someMatrix;` or function calls, `someFunctionTakingQuaternion(someFloat);`. This could lead to not catching odd bugs. Implicitly converting a float to a quat feels bad, but also implicitly converting a matrix to a quat, because not all matrix->quat conversions succeed, if the matrix is of bad form and not a rotation matrix. Perhaps both these constructors should be `explicit`?

Also, several classes have an implicit conversion from a `float *` to the appropriate type:

```
Find all "(const float* data)", Subfolders, Find Results 1, Entire Solution, ""
  C:\code\Urho3D\Source\Urho3D\Math\Color.h(85):    Color(const float* data) :
  C:\code\Urho3D\Source\Urho3D\Math\Matrix3.h(79):    Matrix3(const float* data) :
  C:\code\Urho3D\Source\Urho3D\Math\Matrix3x4.h(147):    Matrix3x4(const float* data)
  C:\code\Urho3D\Source\Urho3D\Math\Matrix4.h(145):    Matrix4(const float* data)
  C:\code\Urho3D\Source\Urho3D\Math\Quaternion.h(81):    Quaternion(const float* data)
  C:\code\Urho3D\Source\Urho3D\Math\Rect.h(67):    Rect(const float* data) :
  C:\code\Urho3D\Source\Urho3D\Math\Vector2.h(57):    Vector2(const float* data) :
  C:\code\Urho3D\Source\Urho3D\Math\Vector3.h(83):    Vector3(const float* data) :
  C:\code\Urho3D\Source\Urho3D\Math\Vector4.h(71):    Vector4(const float* data) :
```

Perhaps it would be safest to make all of these `explicit` as well?

data.title: hot_sse
data.body: SSE optimizes hot arithmetic functions in 06_SkeletalAnimation sample with 10000 Jacks in it. This improves the performance of that sample by roughly +19%.

data.title: BoundingBox::Clip() logic?
data.body: The swap test in https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/3dcab4c039374515ac3d5e66621c7e17aff25dde/Source/Urho3D/Math/BoundingBox.cpp#L108 looks a bit fishy. Isn't the intent of `BoundingBox::Clip(box)` to discard/cut off the parts of `this` box that lie outside the given box `box`? In that case, if the first tests make the result degenerate, shouldn't the degeneracy test set `defined_ = false;` instead of swapping `min_` and `max_`?

data.title: Add type info for object, make type info more general.
data.body:
Current Urho3D's object type system is very simple, but missing some information for type checking, for example, Is Button class is type of BorderImage etc.
Add type info will make it more general for type checking, for detail information, please view the 'type-info' branch.

data.title: unsynchronized_jacks
data.body: Make Jacks not walk in synchronized lockstep timing in 06_SkeletalAnimation sample.

data.title: URHO3D_SSE build option targets SSE1 or SSE2?
data.body:
It's slightly unclear whether `URHO3D_SSE` is meant to target SSE1 or SSE2. In one hand it apparently looks like it's SSE1, since it is configured to pass `/arch:SSE` and `-msse` to the build in CMake, but on the other hand, Bullet is configured to build with SIMD enabled if `URHO3D_SSE` is set, and since Bullet SIMD support requires SSE2, currently enabling `URHO3D_SSE` requires SSE2 support to exist.

The Travis CI check in PR https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/940 fails, because it adds new SSE2 code, but only `-msse` is passed when `URHO3D_SSE` is set, which fails the build.

To fix this discrepancy, would you prefer that

a) `URHO3D_SSE` is taken to mean SSE2 support, so CMake should update to use `/arch:SSE2` and `-msse2`, or
b) add a separate `URHO3D_SSE2=1` CMake option and compile-time #define, and only enable Bullet to build with SIMD enabled if `URHO3D_SSE2=1` is specified.

I'd favor option a), since there is extremely few hardware out there that would only have SSE1.
